subject: Programming
title: The C Programming Language
description: A quick, practical guide to The C Programming Language.

hook.text: Dennis Ritchie needed a language powerful enough to build an operating system from scratch.

buildup.text: In 1972, he created C at Bell Labs â€” fast like assembly but readable like a high-level language.

discovery.text: C gave programmers direct access to memory and hardware while keeping code portable.

twist.text: That power came with danger. One wrong pointer could crash the entire system.

climax.text: C became the foundation of Unix, Windows, Linux, and most systems software still running.

punchline.text: The language behind your operating system.
